subject: Tetris example (was: Re: [junit] More example JUnit code)
msgSnippet: Esko, I like the style.  I m glad you were able to get the BDD-style expressiveness you wanted with just 170 lines of easily-parseable extension code! David
messageBody:
Esko,

I like the style. I'm glad you were able to get the BDD-style
expressiveness you wanted with just 170 lines of easily-parseable
extension code!

David Saff

On Sun, Aug 22, 2010 at 7:49 PM, Esko Luontola <esko.luontola@...> wrote:
> I'll join by posting an example of my style. :)
>
> http://github.com/orfjackal/tdd-tetris-tutorial
>
> It's more focused on learning TDD, but might also serve as a JUnit
> example. The 'beyond' branch contains also a mocking example
> (http://github.com/orfjackal/tdd-tetris-tutorial/blob/beyond/src/test/java/tetris/RemovingFullRowsTest.java).
> The tests use a small custom test runner which enables nesting JUnit
> test classes, in order to enable my style.
>
>
> Simon Chappell wrote on 23.8.2010 1:47:
>> Following up on my previous offering of example JUnit code, I have pushed a
>> project called Fraction to GitHub. This implements classic mathematical
>> fractions and was written in a test first manner and has documented unit
>> tests to help those learning JUnit see one style (my style!) of test
>> implementation.
>
> --
> Esko Luontola
> www.orfjackal.net
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
